content: noro silk garden fingerless mitts virginia burrow december 2015 i made up my pattern as i went along using parts of other glove patterns made for much finer wool and a fair bit of trial and error i have written up my notes fairly loosely so i can remember what i did for next time feel free to follow along but please bear in mind i m no pattern writer  it s a simple pattern - i have made several pairs of these and hopefully these instructions should work for other knitters if you encounter errors please let me know prior experience in knitting in the round is assumed needles 3 75mm circular 80cm for magic loop method or dpns if preferred wool noro silk garden 10ply i was able to just get a pair of medium mitts from one 50g ball the larger mitts took approx 35g each medium ladies gauge 21sts/29 row per 4 on stocking stitch worked in the round sizes medium ladies large mens my hands are 7 25 inches around the palm measured just above the thumb the medium size is a perfect fit for me but they have reasonable stretch and would be fine for slightly smaller or larger hands the mens size fits an 8 25 inch hand give or take first right mitt cuff  cast on 36 40 sts using long-tail cast-on work one row of k2p2 rib join as for circular knitting and work 16 17 more row of rib  work 3 row of plain knitting before starting gusset shaping for the thumb gusset shaping same for both sizes  row 1 k2 m1 k1 m1 knit to end of row  row 2&3 knit to end of row  row 4 k2 m1 k3 m1 knit to end of row  row 5&6 knit to end of row  row 7 k2 m1 k5 m1 knit to end of row  row 8&9 knit to end of row  continue increasing in the same manner increasing the number of stitches between top - large mens mitts bottom - medium ladies mitts the m1s by two every third row until you have 13 stitches between the m1s this will be a total of 7 increase row work 4 more row of knit after the final increase row before starting the thumb division 50 54 stitches 1 divide for thumb and knit hand  k2 place next 15 stitches onto a piece of thick scrap yarn cast on 3 stitches e-cast-on to close the hand knit to end of row 38 42 stitches  knit one row  k1 ssk k1 k2tog knit to end of row 36 40 stitches  knit 7 8 more row  k2p2 rib 11 12 row cast off loosely in rib normal cast off don t use an extra stretchy bind off method but do keep it loose so that finger movement won t be restricted thumb  transfer 15 stitches from scrap
